page.title: 08Pastimes Around Skipwith
page.content: Although the area lacks a public park or sports and recreation ground, a wide range of leisure activities may be enjoyed. The most obvious pastime is birdwatching on Skipwith Common. The tracks around the common are ideal for walkers, joggers, horseriders. Some brave souls may be tempted to swim in the washdikes. Sledging down Dane'S hill is popular in winter with local children. The disused airfield runways provide an excellent training ground for learner drivers and plenty of space for model aeroplane enthusiasts. The runways are also a safe place for go-karting. The pleasant country lanes provide good cycle routes. Some people prefer poaching and shooting pheasant. One resident from nearby Riccall uses the common to occasionally practice firing his cannon!
